name: Мицена молочная - Mycena galopus
comment:
Mycena galopus is a small, delicate mushroom with a conical to bell-shaped cap that ranges in color from pale grey to white. The cap can reach up to 4 cm in diameter, and it has a distinctive milk-white color. The stem is thin, long and fragile, and can grow up to 10 cm tall.

This species is found in deciduous and coniferous forests, usually in groups, on dead wood or on the ground. It is widely distributed in North America, Europe, and Asia, and it is often seen in the autumn and winter months.

Mycena galopus contains various bioactive compounds, including antioxidants and polysaccharides, which may have therapeutic potential. Research has also shown that it can accumulate heavy metals from the environment, making it useful for environmental monitoring.

The spores of Mycena galopus are ellipsoid to oblong, smooth, and measure around 7-10 µm long. The basidia, the cells that produce spores, are four-spored.

This mushroom has a mild taste and is not considered toxic. However, it is not widely consumed due to its small size and fragile nature. In some cultures, it has been used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.

Overall, Mycena galopus is an interesting and widely distributed mushroom with potential therapeutic and environmental applications.
title: Mycena galopus - Мицена молочная - Milk-white Mycena - Milchweißer Helmling
